aboutMe.paraOne: If you're a recruiter who's just looking for keywords to decide whether I fit the bill, here you go:
aboutMe.paraTwo: I brainstorm in Miro. I wireframe and design with Adobe XD | Figma. I develop websites in React (CRA, NextJS) I also develop apps with React Native (and a lot of patience). I jot down my thoughts on NotesApp (more on that below). I collaborate over Slack and Discord.
aboutMe.paraThree:
For the rest of you: I help create products that focus on user experience and performance. Working in the front-end side of things and getting to interact with a lot of designers sparked an interest in me towards designing, and that's how I began my journey into this world of personas and wireframes.
I've had the opportunity to work on a variety of UI/UX projects both as a developer and designer. This unique viewpoint helps me bridge the gap between both the teams, as well as speed up the handover process.
When I'm not working, you can find me watching football, playing football, or gaming. Football games of course. I also tend to my garden, tinker with the PC I built myself, and if I have some time left I write at Plain English and Bootcamp. And did I mention I like football?

landingPage.paraOne: I’m Abhishek, a developer / designer based out of Bangalore, India. Currently, I work as a Product Engineer at Piktorlabs.
landingPage.paraTwo: I enjoy contributing to user experience and research and that's where I look to improve my skills. I also enjoy creating interfaces, as well as bringing them to life, on web, android and iOS.
landingPage.title: I'm Abhishek

letsTalk.paragraph: If you’d like to discuss a freelance project, a full time job opportunity, or you would just like to talk about how I went about creating this site, feel free to hit me up below :)

projects.description: Along with a friend of mine, I took up a project to redesign and develop the Intersectional feminist magazine website. It gave me the change to work along a talented architect turned designer, and use my interdisciplinary skills to reduce the friction between design and development.
projects.title: Case Study: Redesigning the website for ‘The Intersectional Feminist’

projects.description: A journey from initial conception to finalised app design in 14 weeks. It's complete with iOS and android mock ups, ready for handover. This project was a result of the UI/UX course I attended at DesignBoat. It helped me get a firm grasp of the entire product life cycle.
projects.title: Case Study: Creating a specialized experience for sneaker-heads

projects.description: The story of improving UI skills and a test of my durability, with a 100 day challenge. I started the challenge a beginner to the world of design tools and online resources. By the time I finished, they were in the palm of my hand.
projects.title: Daily UI Challenge: 100 days, 100 problem statements, 100 screens

projectsPage.text: Here is some of my work
projectsPage.title: Projects:

devProjects.description: As part of learning UI/UX design, I decided to redesign my website and work on it. Soon I completed the design and development. I wondered if there was an easier way for me to deploy. The current method involved merging code into master, and then manual deployment through the CLI.
devProjects.title: Host Your Own React Site with Firebase and Github Actions

devProjects.description: In 2020, we saw a long period of time where everyone had to stay home. The WFH culture grew global, and now everything moved online. I decided to get in on the action, by creating a simple game using my skills.
devProjects.title: Tic Tac Toe

devProjects.description: A young developer, I had recently learnt to build a mobile app. This got my mind racing. Creating anything that could run on billions of devices, I was living an earlier dream. So, I set about trying to build something that I would use, that someone else might use. And this is the story of how I created NotesApp.
devProjects.title: NotesApp: A minimalistic application to take, and keep track of notes.

testimonials.name: The IF Mag team
testimonials.role: I helped redesign and develop their blog
testimonials.message: Would I recommend Abhishek to my friends? Definitely!  Abhishek is a complete package when it comes to design and development!
